meanings.definition: Dryopithecines: extinct primates that lived in the Miocene epoch.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study dryopithecines to learn about ancient primates.
meanings.sent2: Fossils of dryopithecines provide valuable insights into prehistoric life.
meanings.sent3: The museum exhibit on dryopithecines made the kids curious about ancient animals.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the dryopithecines were portrayed as wise elders of the forest.
meanings.sent5: Imagining the dryopithecines swinging through the trees brings history to life.

meanings.definition: Dryopithecines: a group of hominoids that are believed to be ancestors of modern apes and humans.
meanings.sent1: Researchers study the bones of dryopithecines to understand human evolution.
meanings.sent2: The dryopithecines' characteristics offer clues about our evolutionary past.
meanings.sent3: At the party, someone joked that they must be related to dryopithecines because of their long arms.
meanings.sent4: The idea of dryopithecines as our ancestors sparks curiosity about our origins.
meanings.sent5: Learning about the similarities between humans and dryopithecines is fascinating.
